law: SB-976 Protecting Our Kids from Social Media Addiction Act
reasoning: The feature implements a default setting of 'Not Recommended' (NR) for Personalized Feeds (PF) for users under 18 in California, aligning with the requirements of SB-976. This setting is only overridden with explicit parental consent. The implementation includes geo-detection (GH) to identify users in California and uses feature rollout monitoring (FR).
potential_violations: No potential violations are identified as the feature is designed to comply with SB-976 by disabling personalized feeds by default for minors in California without parental consent.
evidence: Feature description states: 'As part of compliance with Californiaâ€™s SB976, the app will disable PF (Personalized feed) by default for users under 18 located in California.'
recommendations: Continue monitoring feature rollout and ensure geo-detection accuracy to maintain compliance. Keep records of parental consent for audit purposes.
legal_references: SB-976, specifically sections addressing addictive feeds and parental consent requirements.
